resources.string:
Used for:
a) the 'Special' consist function following options.
b) non-roster locos when using the DCC-EX native protocol.

For 'a' Select how the text of each function will be searched for in the function labels for each loco in the consist.

Engine Driver - Throttle for your Android phone. This application can connect to a JMRI, DCC-EX, MRC or DigiTrax WiThrottle server, or DCC-EX native server, and in turn control your locomotives. Speed, direction, and up to 29 DCC functions are supported for one to six locomotives.
Enter labels and function#s, in the order you\'d like them displayed. Leave label blank to hide button. Used when roster functions are not available.
Limit the Function Labels shown if not available from the Server roster
Number of Default Functions for Roster
Limit the Function Labels shown for Server Roster Entries with no function Labels
Click a loco to change its direction with respect to the front of the consist. Swipe Right on a loco to remove it from the consist. Press Back Arrow when done.
Server has the WiThrottle power control setting to off.\nWill now remove Power Icon.\nWill display again when Server setting is on.
Press button to toggle layout power state.
Power Control not allowed. Change in Preferences/Settings on server.
Attempting to Reconnect automatically. Wait for Reconnection or press BackArrow to Exit.
WARNING: changes to Default Functions Settings will be lost on exit - No SD card found.
Recent Connections unavailable - No SD card found.
Recent Locos unavailable - No SD card found.
Locally stored images only. If your server has an image for the loco, it will overwrite this selection.
Your server has an image for the loco. You can\'t change the local image as it will be automatically overwitten by the one on the server.
Options for swipe up or down on the Throttle screen
Set a name for this device (shown on WiThrottle Server)
Options for Speed Slider and Speed buttons
Use a taller Slider, or Speed buttons, for throttles
Do not show speed slider, use speed buttons instead
Show neither speed slider nor speed buttons
Stop loco if you change direction while moving
Enables Loco Select button when moving
Show loco DCC Address(es) instead of the Roster Name(s) on the Throttle screen
Increase Throttle Web View size to 60\% for small screens
Use Immersive Mode for Throttle view?
Display the Throttle view full screen. Set Swipe up or down options to temporarily disable and reach the menu.
Set to also hide the Toolbar in immersive mode
Swipe up action in the Throttle screen?
What should happen when you swipe up on the Throttle screen.
Swipe down action in the Throttle view?
What should happen when you swipe down on the Throttle screen.
Use Volume buttons to control speed
How much Volume buttons jump throttle speed
Choose the Gamepad\/USB type and related options
Choose the option that best supports your gamepad
Set the volume percent for gamepad button clicks
How long between repeats on Gamepad speed buttons. Smaller is faster.
How much each press of the Gamepad buttons changes the throttle speed
Choose the action when you press the button
Choose the action when you press any button that as configured as \\\'Stop\\\'
Select this if you have problems with the DPad producing both keycodes and joystick events
Choose the action when you press the button
Choose the action when you press the button
Choose the action when you press the button
Choose the action when you press the button
How long between repeats on device side buttons.\nSmaller is faster.
How long for a \'long-press\' of the Stop button.\nA \'long-press\' stops all active throttles; a \'short-press\' pauses the current throttle.\nSmaller is faster.
A \'short-press\' pauses the currently controlled locomotive/consist.\nWill revert to original speed when operations resume.
Set the Control Knob zero trim setting.\nSmaller is closer to counter-clockwise end-stop position.\nPermitted range 0–255.
Allow Loco direction to change when control knob at counter-clockwise end-stop position
Allow the control knob to be disabled by an action button on the throttle screen
Loco change not allowed: Mobile Control II currently in stop mode
Throttle change not allowed: Mobile Control II currently in stop mode
Button presses not allowed: Mobile Control II currently in stop mode
When and how the default Function Labels are displayed
Display the default Function Labels instead of labels from roster entries
Use smaller buttons for the Loco Number, Speed and Direction buttons
How many throttles to display on the Throttle Screen.\n(Limited by the selected Throttle Screen Layout.)
Pressing the Android \'Back\' button twice within 3 seconds on the \'Throttle\' or \'Connection\' screen will exit Engine Driver
Select a Throttle Screen Layout.\n(The number in brackets after the name is the number of throttles the layout can support.)
Maximum Allowed throttle slider value in % in ALL sliders
Options for Throttle Web View appearance (Web page that will appear at the bottom of the Throttle Screen)
Include web view on Throttle screen
Additional In Phone Loco Sounds preferences
Play basic loco sounds in the phone for Throttle 1
Play basic loco sounds in the phone for Throttle 2
Volume for Loco engine sounds in the phone (1-100)
Volume for Bell sounds in the phone (1-100)
Volume for Horn/Whistle sounds in the phone (1-100)
Delay (momentum) per step change in milliseconds (0-2000)
Loco step sounds will play till their end when changing step. Momentum amount (above) becomes a minimum time only.
Recommend that you increase the Function Buttons Area size, or you won\'t be able to access the Bell/Horn/Mute sound functions
F1 and F2 also activate IPLS Bell and Horn
F1 and F2 activate Bell and Horn?
Hide IPLS mute button on throttles
Show an action bar button to change the in phone loco sounds options
Send Horn/Bell functions to only the Lead unit in an EngineDriver consist. (Only/any function with a \'label\' that includes \'bell\', \'horn\' or \'whistle\' as part of the label.)
For the \'Selective Lead Unit Sound\' option
For the \'Selective Lead Unit Sound\' option
Stop loco(s) when a phone call is answered or placed
Stop loco(s) when releasing from throttle
Include Routes screen when swiping between screens
Include Web Screen when swiping between screens
Include Turnouts Screen when swiping between screens
Drop current loco before acquiring new loco
Omit Turnout/Route from list if the user name is empty
Include roster selections in Recent list?
Include Loco names from the roster in Recent list if a matching address is found
Unable to find any entries in the Server roster. Use either the \'DCC Address\' or \'Recent\' option instead.
Show an option to Filter the Roster by Owner
Enter the DCC Address of your loco above and click \'Acquire\'.\n\nAlternately, select a loco from the Server \'Roster\' or select from \'Recent\' locos by clicking one of the radio buttons above.
Maximum Recent Locos to show in list
Default Loco Address Length, (Auto will set based on # of digits)
Display speed as percentage, or by a specific number of steps
Enter the initial Web Page (such as \'/panel\') for the Web Screen
Maximum Recent Connections to show in list
Set initial connection timeout in milliseconds
Set socket read timeout in milliseconds
Percentage of the heartbeat period for when to send the heartbeat (50%-90%).\nWill take effect on next connection.
Hide system names for Routes, used to save space on Route list
Set the character that marks the end of the Location portion of Turnout and Route names
Brightness setting to use when dimming the screen (0%-99%). Disables Auto or Adaptive Brightness if set.
Show loco Emergency Stop button in action bar
Show Layout Power button in action bar
Number of pixels to offset margins of throttle speed sliders
Number of pixels to offset margins of the stop button from the speed buttons and bottom of screen.
Connect automatically to \'first\' WiThrottle Server discovered
Set format for Fast Clock display in action bar
Display buttons next to Speed Sliders to change loco speed
Additional highlight of the Loco Select button based on the selection method
What happens when you click the App Icon or App Name on the Action Bar.
Disables the hardware Volume keys on the phone/tablet that would otherwise control speed
The Volume keys speed control will follow the last touched throttle
How long between repeats on speed buttons.\nSmaller is faster. Excludes gamepad buttons. (See separate gamepad setting.)
How much Speed buttons jump throttle speed
Force the speed step to be used when long pressing a lower speed on the slider. If not checked, the speed will immediately jump to the touched speed.
Show or hide less common preferences
Control consist Lights on long click
Change the Lights of the individual locos in a Consist with a long click on the Loco Select button.

Click on a Loco to toggle the Lights for that Loco \'Off\', \'On\' or \'Follow Function Button\'. \nLong Click on a Loco to force the light status \'Off\', without sending the command to the Loco .(i.e. if ED is confused).

'Import' or 'Export' preferences to the '\Android\data\jmri.enginedriver\files\' folder, or 'Reset' them.
Will occur IMMEDIATELY on selecting the option.
WARNING! With 'Reset' and 'Import', Engine Driver will restart!
(You can transfer the preferences to a different phone by copying the file.)
Include the locos in the recent loco list in \'Imports\' and \'Exports\'

On every connection to a host, AUTOMATICALLY \'Import\' preferences for that host, and optionally \'Export\' them on disconnect. \n(To constantly reset back to a known state, set to \'Auto import on connect only\' after the first time, or after a manual save (below).)

\'Import\' or \'Export\' your preferences for a specific host to the \'\\Android\\data\\jmri.enginedriver\\files\\\' folder. The host must be in your recent connection list.\nWill occur IMMEDIATELY on selecting the option.\n(Only available when not currently connected.)
Import from \'\\Android\\data\\jmri.enginedriver\\files\\ %1$s\' failed! You may not have saved the preferences for this host yet.

Automatically import the preferences from servers on connection.\n(If the file \'[jmri railroad base folder]\\prefs\\engine_driver\\auto_preferences.ed\' is on the server and if it is more recent that the last time checked.)

New Preferences file has been found on this server: (%1$s).
Do you want to import it?

Warning!
'Full' - All your preferences will be overwitten.

'Partial' - All preferences, except Theme and some Throttle Layout preferences, will be overwitten.
Permanently swap the two Direction buttons for all throttles
Temporarily swap the two Direction buttons with a long press of any Direction button
Swap Direction buttons with Screen buttons?
Temporarily swap the two Gamepad Direction buttons if the Screen Direction buttons are swapped
Test each gamepad every time they are connected
Only test that you can reduce speed
Labels for all LEFT direction buttons. Enter \'Forward\' or blank for normal behaviour.
Labels for all RIGHT direction buttons. Enter \'Reverse\' or blank for normal behaviour.
Short Labels for all LEFT direction buttons. Enter \'Fwd\' or blank for normal behaviour.
Labels for all Short RIGHT direction buttons. Enter \'Rev\' or blank for normal behaviour.
Show tick marks on the background of the Speed Sliders
Select a visual appearance for this app
Hide the Demo Server \'jmri.mstevetodd.com\' in the connection list
How many milliseconds constitutes a long press for the direction buttons
Options for device motion on the Throttle screen
Options for when you shake the device
Threshold at which the shake will register. (1.5–3.5) Lower value will respond to a gentle action.\nRequires restart of engine Driver after changing to take effect.
Language to use for this app
Show a button to temporarily restrict the maximum speed on an individual throttle
Show a button to slow and stop the locomotive, then return to original speed on next press
Number of milliseconds between speed step changes for the Pause action
Step size changes for the Pause action
Show alternate \'Pause\' button near the \'Stop\' button. (Vertical layouts only)
Set the \% of the throttle that the speed will be temporarily limited to
Set the size of the dead zone on the slider of the Switching Throttle Screen
Optional (may not be on the device)

Scroll down to see the full instructionsâ€¦

Press ALL Dpad AND four primary buttons or the gamepad WILL NOT WORK.

If you can't activate all buttons, change the gamepad mode (see the instructions that came with your gamepad) or try a different gamepad Type (above).

'BACK' or 'CANCEL' will exit the test but the gamepad WILL NOT WORK.
'SKIP', or pressing the 'Decrease Speed' gamepad button three times, will force the test to pass, even if the gamepad does not work properly.
'RESET' will make ED think no gamepads have been used yet.
If 'simple' test is selected, a single 'Decrease Speed' button press will skip the test.

Use the 'Gamepad Test n' menu options to get back to this screen.

Select 'Skip' below to use the keyboard 
----------------- 
Keyboard Commands 
----------------- 
Up or '+' or '=' = Increase Speed 
Down or '-' = Decrease Speed 
'X' = Stop 
Left or '\[' = Reverse (Forward if buttons swapped in preferences) 
Right or '\]' = Forward (Ahead) (Reverse if buttons swapped in preferences) 
'D' = Direction - Toggle Forward/Reverse 
'N' = Next Throttle 
'Z' = All stop 
 
F00 - F28 = Function 
Must be 'F' followed by two digits 
'0'-'9' = Functions 0-9 
Without a preceding 'F', 'S' or 'L' 
 
S000 - S100 = Speed 
Must be 'S' followed by three digits 
 
In Phone Loco Sounds (IPLS) 
'B' = Bell 
'H' = Horn / Whistle 
Shift + 'H' = Short Horn 
'M' or Volume Mute = Mute IPLS 
 
T0 - T5 = Specify a throttle for next command 
Must be 'T' followed by one digit 
The following command will sent to the specified throttle regardless of the currently selected gamepad throttle. 
 
All other keyCodes are ignored 
 
Failure to follow the 'F', 'S' or 'L' with the correct number of digits will ignore the command

If you can\'t activate all buttons, change the gamepad mode (see the instructions that came with your device) or try a different gamepad Type (above).\nYou may be required to re-test the gamepad when you first use it from the throttle screen.
Allows you to confirm that the chosen setting works correctly.\nTest screen will launch IMMEDIATELY on selection.
If enabled Engine Driver will not check for multiple gamepads.
Timeout waiting for WiThrottle \'VN\' message from %1$s:%2$s. Disconnecting
Timeout waiting for DCC-EX \'iDCCEX...\' message from %1$s:%2$s. Disconnecting
No local IP Address found.\nCheck your WiFi connection.
Error creating withrottle zeroconf listener: IOException:\n%1$s
Can\'t connect to %1$s:%2$s from %3$s - %4$s\nCheck WiThrottle Server and network settings.
Using %1$s network, not WIFI.\nCheck your WiFi settings and Preferences.\n
Not connected to a network. Check WiFi settings.\n\nRetrying
No response from server %1$s:%2$s for %3$dms. Check that the WiThrottle Server is running.\n\nRetrying
Unable to connect to server at %1$s:%2$s from %3$s. Retrying
Press \'Back\' again to exit Engine Driver
Unable to set the Auto Brightness/ Adaptive Brightness.
Accelerometer not found or is disabled
Loco change not allowed: \'Direction change while moving\' is disabled in the preferences
Direction Buttons temporarily swapped. To permanently swap them, change in preferences
Immersive mode temporarily disabled. To disable permanently change in preferences
Throttle Web View temporarily hidden. Shake again to show. To hide permanently change in preferences
Throttle Web View must be enabled in the preferences first
Throttle Screen Locked - Shake again to unlock
Action not allow while Throttle Screen is Locked
Throttle Screen Dimmed - Shake again to restore
Throttle Screen Locked - Swipe again to unlock
Throttle Screen Dimmed - Swipe again to restore
Throttle Web View temporarily hidden. To hide permanently change in preferences
Alert: Engine %1$s is set to ESTOP
Value entered is outside the limits (%1$s-%2$s). Reset to %3$s.
Value entered is not numeric (%1$s-%2$s). Reset to %3$s.
Preferences Import from Server failed! Check the file is correct. (%1$s)
Enter or select an address and port
Unable to save host specific preferences. Can\'t get host name.
Unable to load host specific preferences. Can\'t get host name.
The demo Server can only be removed by modifying the preferences.
Auto Preferences Import from Server Succeeded. (%1$s)
Preferences not imported from \'\\Android\\data\\jmri.enginedriver\\files\\%1$s\'. You may not have saved the preferences for this host yet.
Can\'t import preferences. Not connected to a host.
Chosen Throttle Screen Layout does not support that many throttles. Changing to %1$s.

Touch to select a Recent Entry,
 or change entry method.
Long press to rename.
Swipe Right to remove an entry.

Touch to select a Consist Entry,
 or change entry method.
Long press to Rename (for entered addresses) or show Roster Details.
Swipe Right to remove an entry.
Touch to select a Roster Entry,\n or change entry method.\nLong press for details.
Touch to select a Server,\n or enter Server Address and Port.\nSwipe Right to remove an entry.
Touch to change facing. Swipe Right to remove an entry.
Logging Started in file %1$s. Logging will continue until you exit the Engine Driver app.
Enter a name for the Loco
Enter a name for the Consist
When to speak key events and actions using Text to Speech (TTS)
When you select a different throttle on the gamepad
When the speed hits certain speeds when using a gamepad
When the gamepad test screen is launched
When each buttons is pressed in the gamepad test screen
When the gamepad test screen is finished
Show Flashlight button in action bar
Sorry! There was a problem switching on the flashlight…
Sorry! There was a problem switching off the flashlight…
Show button in action bar to show/hide Throttle Web View.\n(requires \'Throttle Web View\' preference to be enabled)
Consist & Default Functions - Follow Rule Style

Which style of rules to follow when function buttons are pressed in either a) a consist , b) when enforcing the Default Function labels.\nNote: If \'Use Default function labels\' is enabled, \'Special...\' will also apply to the lead (or only) loco.
Options for how functions will behave in a consist.
Which locos in the consist should react to the function buttons if none of the rules below are meet.
Comma separated string(s) to look for in the function labels of the locos in the consist to recognise the \'Headlight\' function (normally F0).
Which locos in the consist should react to the found headlight functions.
Comma separated string(s) to look for in the function labels of the locos in the consist to recognise a similar function.
Which locos in the consist should react to the found functions.
Comma separated string(s) to look for in the function labels of the locos in the consist to recognise a similar function.
Which locos in the consist should react to the found functions.
Comma separated string(s) to look for in the function labels of the locos in the consist to recognise a similar function.
Which locos in the consist should react to the found functions.
Comma separated string(s) to look for in the function labels of the locos in the consist to recognise a similar function.
Which locos in the consist should react to the found functions.
Options for young children.\nTime controlled running.

- select the loco first.
- Timer will start with the first increase in speed.
- You must come back to this preference to reset the time (or clear it) after the timeout.

Recommendations:
- Disable the volume keys.
- Disable 'Swipe Through Turnouts'.
- Disable 'Swipe Through Routes'.
- Disable EStop.
Restrict the time that the loco will run. e.g. Each child (operator) will get an equal amount of time.
Password to restart the timer with the current settings
Password to reset/disable the timer settings
Display the Timer Action Bar Button to activate the timer
Default time if using the Action Bar Button to activate the timer
Allow your device to connect to JMRI over Mobile Data
Show the description of the current server on the action bar
Engine Driver needs STORAGE permissions to load background images.
Engine Driver needs PHONE permissions to pause operations when on a call.
Engine Driver needs ALLOW MODIFYING SYSTEM SETTINGS permissions to change screen brightness.
- Click the button below.\n- Grant the permission.\n- Click \'Back\' to return here.
Ignore this if you don\'t need Engine Driver to alter the brightness.
Engine Driver needs ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION permissions to retrieve current wifi SSID.
Engine Driver needs VIBRATE permissions to provide additional feedback.
Engine Driver needs STORAGE permissions to store recent connections and PHONE permissions to pause operations when on a call.
Engine Driver needs READ_MEDIA_IMAGES permissions to load background images.
Engine Driver needs NOTIFICATION permissions to warn you when push into background.

This app can connect to a JMRI, MRC, DigiTrax, WifiTrax, IoTT Stick or DCC-EX WiThrottle server, or DCC-EX native server, to control your DCC locos and devices. It can also read/write CVs and control DC locos on an DCC-EX EX-CommandStation. \nThe following pages will guide you through initial setup.
Set a name for this device
The name you choose will appear in the WiThrottle Server window. It can help when resolving problems with multiple devices. It must be unique.
Choose the colors and appearance of the whole app
Choose the layout of the main throttle screen
Depending on the chosen layout, you will be limited on the number of individual throttles (1 to 6) on the screen
Engine Driver is now ready to connect.
For detailed instructions, see the \'About\' page from the menu or visit the Engine Driver Home page at \n\'https://enginedriver.mstevetodd.com\'.
You can make additional changes to the appearance and behaviour of the app from the \'Preferences\' menu.
Choose how to control the speed of your trains

Engine Driver can provide additional functionality, including CV programming, if you are using a DCC-EX EX-CommandStation directly. (Not via JMRI)\n\nIf you respond \'Yes\' below, Engine Driver will default to using DCC-EX Native commands instead of WiThrottle if the server name contains \'DCC-EX\' or \'DCCEX\'.
Yes, I will be using an EX-CommandStation
No, I will NOT be using an EX-CommandStation
Please re-start the Engine Driver app to complete the Introduction
Confirm that you want remove all the Recent Locomotives
Confirm that you want remove all the Recent Consists
Confirm that you want remove all the Recent Turnouts
Confirm that you want remove all the Recent Connections
Confirm that you want reset all preferences.\nALL current preferences will be lost.
Confirm that you want import preferences.\nALL current preferences will be lost.
Show a background image on the Throttle screen
Enter the name of the background image file.
Select how the background image will be positioned on the screen.
Show the Throttle Layout Switch button in the Throttle Screen action bar to allow quick changing of Throttle Layouts
Layout Switch Button will switch between this throttle layout and the next preference
Layout Switch Button will switch between the throttle layout in the previous preference and this one
Number of Function Buttons (0-4) to show on the Simple Throttle layout
Show Date Time for each entry on the log screen
Choose if the WiThrottle CV Programming on MAIN (Operations Mode) menu and page should be available.
Play sound and vibrate on unexpected disconnect
Audible alert when the app is sent to the background

Use native DCC-EX <> commands instead of WiThrottle for all connections. For \'Auto\', name must contain \"DCCEX\" or \"DCC-EX\" or use port 2560\nNote: Will not take effect until you restart Engine Driver and connect to a server.
Always use function labels from server
When disabled, use EngineDriver default labels for locos selected by address (not Roster), ignoring server default labels.
WiThrottle or DCC-EX protocol? (\'Auto\' looks for \"DCCEX\", \"DCC-EX\" or port 2560)
Using the DCC-EX protocol.\nUncheck \"Use native DCC-EX commands\" preference to use the WiThrottle protocol.
Show option to switch between WiThrottle and DCC-EX protocols in the Connection Screen.
Show button in action bar to access the DCC-EX screen.\n(For native DCC-EX connections only.)
If checked, only the toolbar can be swiped to change screens
Options for swipes to change screens
Press button to send a request to the server to identify and acquire the loco already on the programming track and return the value to this throttle.

Notes: 
- This will not work on some DCC systems. 
- Loco Address change is prevented - CVs 1, 17 & 18 and bit 5 of CV 29. 

Use with Caution.
Write a value of %d to CV29 to toggle the direction.
